stories.title: Cain and Abel
stories.summary: The first brothers, jealousy, and the consequences of sin.
stories.keyVerse: Genesis 4:7 - If you do what is right, will you not be accepted? But if you do not do what is right, sin is crouching at your door.

stories.title: Jacob and Esau
stories.summary: Sibling rivalry, trickery, and reconciliation.
stories.keyVerse: Genesis 33:4 - But Esau ran to meet Jacob and embraced him; he threw his arms around his neck and kissed him.

stories.title: Jacob's Ladder
stories.summary: God's promise and presence.
stories.keyVerse: Genesis 28:15 - I am with you and will watch over you wherever you go.

stories.title: Moses and the Burning Bush
stories.summary: God's call and assurance.
stories.keyVerse: Exodus 3:14 - God said to Moses, 'I AM WHO I AM. This is what you are to say to the Israelites: I AM has sent me to you.'

stories.title: The Golden Calf
stories.summary: Warning against idolatry.
stories.keyVerse: Exodus 32:8 - They have been quick to turn away from what I commanded them and have made themselves an idol cast in the shape of a calf.

stories.title: Joshua and the Battle of Jericho
stories.summary: God's power in giving victory.
stories.keyVerse: Joshua 6:20 - When the trumpets sounded, the army shouted, and at the sound of the trumpet, when the men gave a loud shout, the wall collapsed.

stories.title: Gideon's Army
stories.summary: God using small things to accomplish big purposes.
stories.keyVerse: Judges 7:2 - The LORD said to Gideon, 'You have too many men. I cannot deliver Midian into their hands.'

stories.title: Samson and Delilah
stories.summary: Strength, weakness, and God's redemption.
stories.keyVerse: Judges 16:28 - Then Samson prayed to the LORD, 'Sovereign LORD, remember me. Please, God, strengthen me just once more.'

stories.title: Ruth and Naomi
stories.summary: Loyalty, kindness, and God's providence.
stories.keyVerse: Ruth 1:16 - But Ruth replied, 'Don't urge me to leave you or to turn back from you. Where you go I will go, and where you stay I will stay.'

stories.title: Esther Saves Her People
stories.summary: Courage and God's hidden hand.
stories.keyVerse: Esther 4:14 - For if you remain silent at this time, relief and deliverance for the Jews will arise from another place.

stories.title: Elijah and the Prophets of Baal
stories.summary: God's power over false gods.
stories.keyVerse: 1 Kings 18:39 - When all the people saw this, they fell prostrate and cried, 'The LORD—he is God! The LORD—he is God!'

stories.title: Jonah and the Great Fish
stories.summary: Obedience, repentance, and God's mercy.
stories.keyVerse: Jonah 2:2 - In my distress I called to the LORD, and he answered me.

stories.title: Jesus Tempted in the Wilderness
stories.summary: Victory over temptation.
stories.keyVerse: Matthew 4:10 - Jesus said to him, 'Away from me, Satan! For it is written: Worship the Lord your God, and serve him only.'

stories.title: The Sermon on the Mount
stories.summary: Teachings on love, forgiveness, and living faithfully.
stories.keyVerse: Matthew 5:3 - Blessed are the poor in spirit, for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.

stories.title: Jesus Heals the Paralytic
stories.summary: Forgiveness and healing.
stories.keyVerse: Mark 2:5 - When Jesus saw their faith, he said to the paralytic, 'Son, your sins are forgiven.'

stories.title: Jesus and the Woman at the Well
stories.summary: Living water and breaking social barriers.
stories.keyVerse: John 4:14 - Whoever drinks the water I give them will never thirst. Indeed, the water I give them will become in them a spring of water welling up to eternal life.

stories.title: Zacchaeus the Tax Collector
stories.summary: Transformation through meeting Jesus.
stories.keyVerse: Luke 19:8 - But Zacchaeus stood up and said to the Lord, 'Look, Lord! Here and now I give half of my possessions to the poor.'

stories.title: The Rich Young Ruler
stories.summary: Choosing between wealth and following Jesus.
stories.keyVerse: Matthew 19:21 - Jesus answered, 'If you want to be perfect, go, sell your possessions and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven.'

stories.title: Jesus Raises Lazarus
stories.summary: Power over death and pointing to resurrection.
stories.keyVerse: John 11:25 - Jesus said to her, 'I am the resurrection and the life. The one who believes in me will live, even though they die.'

stories.title: The Road to Emmaus
stories.summary: Recognizing the risen Christ.
stories.keyVerse: Luke 24:31 - Then their eyes were opened and they recognized him, and he disappeared from their sight.

stories.title: Philip and the Ethiopian Eunuch
stories.summary: Sharing the gospel across cultures.
stories.keyVerse: Acts 8:35 - Then Philip began with that very passage of Scripture and told him the good news about Jesus.

stories.title: Paul's Conversion
stories.summary: Transformation from enemy to apostle.
stories.keyVerse: Acts 9:6 - 'Now get up and go into the city, and you will be told what you must do.'

stories.title: Paul and Silas in Prison
stories.summary: Joy in suffering and God's deliverance.
stories.keyVerse: Acts 16:25 - About midnight Paul and Silas were praying and singing hymns to God, and the other prisoners were listening to them.

stories.title: Creation of the World
stories.summary: God creates the heavens, earth, animals, and humans, showing His power and purpose.
stories.keyVerse: Genesis 1:1 - In the beginning God created the heavens and the earth.

stories.title: Adam and Eve in the Garden
stories.summary: Teaches about temptation, sin, and the need for redemption.
stories.keyVerse: Genesis 3:15 - And I will put enmity between you and the woman, and between your offspring and hers.

stories.title: Noah's Ark
stories.summary: God saves Noah and his family from the flood, a story of judgment and mercy.
stories.keyVerse: Genesis 7:1 - The LORD then said to Noah, 'Go into the ark, you and your whole family, because I have found you righteous in this generation.'

stories.title: Tower of Babel
stories.summary: Explains pride, human ambition, and God's sovereignty.
stories.keyVerse: Genesis 11:4 - Then they said, 'Come, let us build ourselves a city, with a tower that reaches to the heavens.'

stories.title: Abraham and Isaac
stories.summary: A story of faith, trust, and obedience to God.
stories.keyVerse: Genesis 22:8 - Abraham answered, 'God himself will provide the lamb for the burnt offering, my son.'

stories.title: Joseph and His Brothers
stories.summary: A tale of jealousy, forgiveness, and God turning evil for good.
stories.keyVerse: Genesis 50:20 - You intended to harm me, but God intended it for good to accomplish what is now being done.

stories.title: Moses and the Exodus
stories.summary: God delivers Israel from slavery, showing His power and covenant love.
stories.keyVerse: Exodus 14:31 - And when the Israelites saw the great power the LORD displayed against the Egyptians, the people feared the LORD and put their trust in him.

stories.title: The Ten Commandments
stories.summary: God gives His law, a foundation for living faithfully.
stories.keyVerse: Exodus 20:2 - I am the LORD your God, who brought you out of Egypt, out of the land of slavery.

stories.title: David and Goliath
stories.summary: A lesson in courage, faith, and God's strength through the weak.
stories.keyVerse: 1 Samuel 17:45 - David said to the Philistine, 'You come against me with sword and spear and javelin, but I come against you in the name of the LORD Almighty.'

stories.title: Daniel in the Lion's Den
stories.summary: Shows God's protection and the reward for remaining faithful.
stories.keyVerse: Daniel 6:22 - My God sent his angel, and he shut the mouths of the lions.

stories.title: Birth of Jesus
stories.summary: The fulfillment of prophecy and God coming to live among us.
stories.keyVerse: Matthew 1:23 - The virgin will conceive and give birth to a son, and they will call him Immanuel.

stories.title: Baptism of Jesus
stories.summary: Marks the beginning of Jesus' ministry, with God affirming His Son.
stories.keyVerse: Matthew 3:17 - And a voice from heaven said, 'This is my Son, whom I love; with him I am well pleased.'

stories.title: Jesus' Miracles
stories.summary: Healing the sick, calming storms, feeding the 5,000—showing His power and compassion.
stories.keyVerse: Matthew 14:14 - When Jesus landed and saw a large crowd, he had compassion on them and healed their sick.

stories.title: The Good Samaritan
stories.summary: A parable about loving others beyond social or cultural boundaries.
stories.keyVerse: Luke 10:37 - The expert in the law replied, 'The one who had mercy on him.' Jesus told him, 'Go and do likewise.'

stories.title: The Prodigal Son
stories.summary: A parable about forgiveness, repentance, and God's love.
stories.keyVerse: Luke 15:20 - So he got up and went to his father. But while he was still a long way off, his father saw him and was filled with compassion for him.

stories.title: Jesus Walks on Water
stories.summary: Teaches about faith and trust in Christ during trials.
stories.keyVerse: Matthew 14:31 - Immediately Jesus reached out his hand and caught him. 'You of little faith,' he said, 'why did you doubt?'

stories.title: The Last Supper
stories.summary: Jesus institutes communion, pointing to His sacrifice.
stories.keyVerse: Matthew 26:26 - While they were eating, Jesus took bread, and when he had given thanks, he broke it and gave it to his disciples.

stories.title: The Crucifixion
stories.summary: The central story of salvation—Jesus' sacrifice for humanity's sins.
stories.keyVerse: Matthew 27:46 - About three in the afternoon Jesus cried out in a loud voice, 'Eli, Eli, lema sabachthani?'

stories.title: The Resurrection
stories.summary: The triumph over sin and death, the heart of Christian hope.
stories.keyVerse: Matthew 28:6 - He is not here; he has risen, just as he said. Come and see the place where he lay.

stories.title: Pentecost
stories.summary: The coming of the Holy Spirit, empowering the church to spread the gospel.
stories.keyVerse: Acts 2:4 - All of them were filled with the Holy Spirit and began to speak in other tongues as the Spirit enabled them.
